name: Clinical Studies
tagline: about Vegan, Vegetarian and Meat-Eating Diets
body:
(Special thanks to Richard of [Vegan Gains] (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCr2eKhGzPhN5RPVk5dd5o3g/videos) for most of the research).

##Diabetes
* [Vegetarian diets and glycemic control in diabetes: a systematic review and meta-analysis] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25414824)
* [Meat consumption as a risk factor for type 2 diabetes] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24566443) 
* [High processed meat consumption is a risk factor of type 2 diabetes in the Alpha-Tocopherol, Beta-Carotene Cancer Prevention study] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20187985)
* [Vegetarian and vegan diets in type 2 diabetes management] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19386029) - In clinical trials in individuals with type 2 diabetes, low-fat vegan dietsimprove glycemic control to a greater extent than conventional diabetes diets.
* [Vegetarian diet in type 2 diabetes--improvement in quality of life, mood and eating behaviour] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23050853)
* [Veganism and its relationship with insulin resistance and intramyocellular lipid] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15523486)
* [Vegetarian Diets in the Prevention and Treatment of Type 2 Diabetes] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25915002) - vegetarian diets lead to a greater weight loss and greater reduction in fasting plasma glucose, HbA1c, blood lipids, and hypoglycemic medication than a conventional hypocaloric diet in subjects with type 2 diabetes.
* [A low-fat vegan diet and a conventional diabetes diet in the treatment of type 2 diabetes: a randomized, controlled, 74-wk clinical trial] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19339401) - A low-fat vegan diet appeared to improve glycemia and plasma lipids more than did conventional diabetes diet recommendations.
* [A low-fat, vegan diet improves glycemic control and cardiovascular risk factors in a randomized clinical trial in individuals with type 2 diabetes] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=A+low-fat%2C+vegan+diet+improves+glycemic+control+and+cardiovascular+risk+factors+in+a+randomized+clinical+trial+in+individuals+with+type+2+diabetes.) - Both a low-fat vegan diet and a diet based on American Diabetes Association guidelines improved glycemic and lipid control in type 2 diabetic patients. These improvements were greater with a low-fat vegan diet.
* [The effects of a low-fat, plant-based dietary intervention on body weight, metabolism, and insulin sensitivity] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=The+effects+of+a+low-fat%2C+plant-based+dietary+intervention+on+body+weight%2C+metabolism%2C+and+insulin+sensitivity) - Adoption of a low-fat, vegan diet was associated with significant weight loss in overweight postmenopausal women, despite the absence of prescribed limits on portion size or energy intake.
* [High-carbohydrate, high-fiber diets increase peripheral insulin sensitivity in healthy young and old adults] (http://ajcn.nutrition.org/content/52/3/524.long)
* [Interplay between lipids and branched-chain amino acids in development of insulin resistance] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22560213)
* [Impact of the Gut Microbiota on the Development of Obesity] (http://www.nature.com/ajgsup/journal/v1/n1/full/ajgsup20125a.html)
* [Substituting dietary saturated for monounsaturated fat impairs insulin sensitivity in healthy men and women: The KANWU Study] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11317662)
* [Higher insulin sensitivity in vegans is not associated with higher mitochondrial density] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24149445)
* [Free fatty acids and skeletal muscle insulin resistance] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18460913)
* [Taiwanese Vegetarians and Omnivores: Dietary Composition, Prevalence of Diabetes and IFG] (http://journals.plos.org/plosone/article?id=10.1371/journal.pone.0088547)
* [Insulin sensitivity in Chinese ovo-lactovegetarians compared with omnivores] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/14749752)
* [High intake of whole grains and beans pattern is inversely associated with insulin resistance in healthy Korean adult population] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23041226)
* [Fatty acids and glucolipotoxicity in the pathogenesis of Type 2 diabetes] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18481955)
* [Protein Ingestion Induces Muscle Insulin Resistance Independent of Leucine-Mediated mTOR Activation] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25475435)

##Obesity
* [Meat consumption and prospective weight change in participants of the EPIC-PANACEA study] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20592131)
* [Hyperinsulinemia Drives Diet-Induced Obesity Independently of Brain Insulin Production] (http://www.cell.com/cell-metabolism/abstract/S1550-4131(12)00453-6)
* [No evidence of insulin resistance in normal weight vegetarians. A case control study] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15940383)
* [Association of adenovirus infection with human obesity] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9385623)
* [High Vegetable Fats Intake Is Associated with High Resting Energy Expenditure in Vegetarians] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26193314)
* [Higher insulin sensitivity in vegans is not associated with higher mitochondrial density] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24149445)
* [Leucine signaling in the pathogenesis of type 2 diabetes and obesity] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22442749)
* [Plasma alkylresorcinols, biomarkers of whole-grain intake, are related to lower BMI in older adults] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22955514)
* [Whole-grain intake is associated with body mass index in college students] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17346657)
* [Vegetarian Diets and Weight Reduction: a Meta-Analysis of Randomized Controlled Trials] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26138004)

##Cancer
* [Glutamine, glucose and other fuels for cancer] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23859613)
* [A review of methionine dependency and the role of methionine restriction in cancer growth control and life-span extension] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22342103)
* [The low-methionine content of vegan diets may make methionine restriction feasible as a life extension strategy] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18789600) 
* [The Associations of Diet with Serum Insulin-like Growth Factor I and Its Main Binding Proteins in 292 Women Meat-Eaters, Vegetarians, and Vegans] (http://cebp.aacrjournals.org/content/11/11/1441.full.pdf+html)
* [A review of methionine dependency and the role of methionine restriction in cancer growth control and life-span extension] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22342103)
* [Plasma choline metabolites and colorectal cancer risk in the Women's Health Initiative Observational Study] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25336191)
* [Methionine dependency and cancer treatment] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/14585259)
* [Cancer incidence in vegetarians: results from the European Prospective Investigation into Cancer and Nutrition (EPIC-Oxford)] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19279082) - the incidence of all cancers combined was lower among vegetarians than among meat eaters, but the incidence of colorectal cancer was higher in vegetarians than in meat eaters (vegans were not studied)
* [A red meat-derived glycan promotes inflammation and cancer progression] (http://www.pnas.org/content/112/2/542.abstract)
* [Vegetarian diets and the incidence of cancer in a low-risk population] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23169929)
* [Cancer is a Preventable Disease that Requires Major Lifestyle Changes] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2515569/)
* [Total cholesterol and cancer risk in a large prospective study in Korea] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21422422)
* [High ACAT1 expression in estrogen receptor negative basal-like breast cancer cells is associated with LDL-induced proliferation] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19851860) - a low-fat diet was associated with decreased recurrence of estrogen receptor alpha negative breast cancer
* [Cholesterol and breast cancer development] (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22867847)
* [Intensive lifestyle changes may affect the progression of prostate cancer] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16094059)
* [The cooked food derived carcinogen 2-amino-1-methyl-6-phenylimidazo[4,5-b] pyridine is a potent oestrogen: a mechanistic basis for its tissue-specific carcinogenicity] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15319301) - The cooked meat carcinogen 2-amino-1-methyl-6.. induces tumours of the breast, colon and prostate in rats.
* [Insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1), IGF binding protein 3 (IGFBP3), and breast cancer risk: pooled individual data analysis of 17 prospective studies] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3113287/?tool=pubmed)
* [mTORC1 activity as a determinant of cancer risk--rationalizing the cancer-preventive effects of adiponectin, metformin, rapamycin, and low-protein vegan diets] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21862237)
* [Protection against cancer by dietary IP6 and inositol] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17044765)

##Cardiovascular Disease
* [The role of dietary oxidized cholesterol and oxidized fatty acids in the development of atherosclerosis] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16270280)
* [Rapid reduction of serum cholesterol and blood pressure by a twelve-day, very low fat, strictly vegetarian diet] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/8522729)
* [Gut microbiota metabolism of L-carnitine and cardiovascular risk] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24267266)
* [Relation between progression and regression of atherosclerotic left main coronary artery disease and serum cholesterol levels as assessed with serial long-term (> or =12 months) follow-up intravascular ultrasound] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/14623804)
* [Effect of long-term exposure to lower low-density lipoprotein cholesterol beginning early in life on the risk of coronary heart disease: a Mendelian randomization analysis] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23083789)
* [Baked bean consumption reduces serum cholesterol in hypercholesterolemic adults] (http://www.nrjournal.com/article/S0271-5317%2807%2900106-6/abstract)
* [Effect of ingestion of meat on plasma cholesterol of vegetarians] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/7019459) 
* [Effects of dietary cholesterol on serum cholesterol: a meta-analysis and review] (http://ajcn.nutrition.org/content/55/6/1060.long)
* [The importance of the ratio of omega-6/omega-3 essential fatty acids] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/12442909)
* [Long-term low-calorie low-protein vegan diet and endurance exercise are associated with low cardiometabolic risk] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17518696)
* [Lower lifetime dietary fiber intake is associated with carotid artery stiffness: the Amsterdam Growth and Health Longitudinal Study] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22623748)
* [Dietary lipids and blood cholesterol: quantitative meta-analysis of metabolic ward studies] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2125600/)
* [Intestinal microbiota metabolism of L-carnitine, a nutrient in red meat, promotes atherosclerosis] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23563705)

##Auto-Immune Disease
* [Gluten-free vegan diet induces decreased LDL and oxidized LDL levels and raised atheroprotective natural antibodies against phosphorylcholine in patients with rheumatoid arthritis: a randomized study] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18348715)
* [Effects of a very low-fat, vegan diet in subjects with rheumatoid arthritis] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11890437)
* [A vegan diet free of gluten improves the signs and symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis: the effects on arthritis correlate with a reduction in antibodies to food antigens] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11600749) 

##Stroke
* [High dietary fiber intake prevents stroke at a population level] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23317525)

##Longevity
* [Low protein intake is associated with a major reduction in IGF-1, cancer, and overall mortality in the 65 and younger but not older population] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24606898)
* [The low-methionine content of vegan diets may make methionine restriction feasible as a life extension strategy] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18789600)
* [Protein methionine content and MDA-lysine adducts are inversely related to maximum life span in the heart of mammals] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15955547)
* [Nutrient signaling to mTOR and cell growth] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23465396)
* [Anti-inflammatory effects of plant-based foods and of their constituents] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19685439)
* [The Alkaline Diet: Is There Evidence That an Alkaline pH Diet Benefits Health?] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3195546/)
* [Why do centenarians escape or postpone cancer? The role of IGF-1, inflammation and p53] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19139887)
* [Leucine supplementation differentially enhances pancreatic cancer growth in lean and overweight mice] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24685128)
* [Defective regulation of autophagy upon leucine deprivation reveals a targetable liability of human melanoma cells in vitro and in vivo] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=Defective+regulation+of+autophagy+upon+leucine+deprivation+reveals+a+targetable+liability+of+human+melanoma+cells+in+vitro+and+in+vivo)
* [Longitudinal changes in BMI in older adults are associated with meat consumption differentially, by type of meat consumed] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22223576)
* [The effect of replacement of methionine by homocystine on survival of malignant and normal adult mammalian cells in culture] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/4524624)
* [Lowered methionine ingestion as responsible for the decrease in rodent mitochondrial oxidative stress in protein and dietary restriction possible implications for humans] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18252204)
* [Protein methionine content and MDA-lysine adducts are inversely related to maximum life span in the heart of mammals] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15955547)
* [Nutrient Profiles of Vegetarian and Non Vegetarian Dietary Patterns] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4081456/)
* [Veganism and its relationship with insulin resistance and intramyocellular lipid] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15523486)
* [Legumes: the most important dietary predictor of survival in older people of different ethnicities] (http://apjcn.nhri.org.tw/server/APJCN/13/2/217.pdf)
* [A bean-free diet increases the risk of all-cause mortality among Taiwanese women: the role of the metabolic syndrome] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21899787)
* [Lowered methionine ingestion as responsible for the decrease in rodent mitochondrial oxidative stress in protein and dietary restriction possible implications for humans] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18252204)
* [Nutrient signaling to mTOR and cell growth] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23465396)
* [Whole-grain intake is inversely associated with the metabolic syndrome and mortality in older adults] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16400060/)
* [The capacity of foodstuffs to induce innate immune activation of human monocytes in vitro is dependent on food content of stimulants of Toll-like receptors 2 and 4] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20849668)

##Muscle Development
* [Alkaline diets favor lean tissue mass in older adults] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18326605)
* [Hormones and diet: low insulin-like growth factor-I but normal bioavailable androgens in vegan men] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/10883675)
* [Plant foods have a complete amino acid composition] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/12082008)
* [A high-fat diet coordinately downregulates genes required for mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation in skeletal muscle] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15983191)
* [Effect of Protein Intake on Strength, Body Composition and Endocrine Changes in Strength/Power Athletes] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2129168/)

##Bone/Hip Fractures
* [Vegetarian lifestyle and bone mineral density] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=Vegetarian+lifestyle+and+bone+mineral+density.+Am+J+Clin+Nutr+43(3+suppl)%3A837%2C+1988)
* [Relationship of animal protein-rich diet to kidney stone formation and calcium metabolism] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=Relationship+of+animal+protein-rich+diet+to+kidney+stone+formation+and+calcium+metabolism.+J+Clin+Endocrinol+Metab+66%3A140%2C+1988)
* [Bone mineral content of North Alaskan Eskimos] (http://ajcn.nutrition.org/content/27/9/916.abstract)
* [Veganism, bone mineral density, and body composition: a study in Buddhist nuns] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19350341)
* [Phytate (myo-inositol hexaphosphate) and risk factors for osteoporosis] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19053869)
* [Milk intake and risk of mortality and fractures in women and men: cohort studies] (http://www.bmj.com/content/349/bmj.g6015)
* [Protective effect of myo-inositol hexaphosphate (phytate) on bone mass loss in postmenopausal women] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22614760)

##Low-Carb Animal-Based Diets
* [Negative effect of a low-carbohydrate, high-protein, high-fat diet on small peripheral artery reactivity in patients with increased cardiovascular risk] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22850317)
* [The effect of high-protein diets on coronary blood flow] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11108325)
* [Low-carbohydrate diets and all-cause and cause-specific mortality: two cohort studies] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20820038) 
* [Red Meat Consumption and Mortality: Results From 2 Prospective Cohort Studies] (http://archinte.jamanetwork.com/article.aspx?articleid=1134845)
* [Low-carbohydrate diets and all-cause mortality: a systematic review and meta-analysis of observational studies] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23372809)
* [Development of symptomatic cardiovascular disease after self-reported adherence to the Atkins Diet] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=Development+of+symptomatic+cardiovascular+disease+after+self-reported+adherence+to+the+Atkins+Diet.)
* [Effect of a single high-fat meal on endothelial function in healthy subjects] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9036757)
* [A high-fat diet coordinately downregulates genes required for mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation in skeletal muscle] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15983191)
* [A saturated fatty acid-rich diet induces an obesity-linked proinflammatory gene expression profile in adipose tissue of subjects at risk of metabolic syndrome] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19828712)
* [Effect of protein ingestion on the glucose and insulin response to a standardized oral glucose load] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/6389060)
* [Lipotoxicity: effects of dietary saturated and transfatty acids] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23509418)
* [A high-fat meal induces low-grade endotoxemia: evidence of a novel mechanism of postprandial inflammation] (http://ajcn.nutrition.org/content/86/5/1286.full.pdf+html)
* [Effect of a single high-fat meal on endothelial function in healthy subjects] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/9036757)
* [Effects of a high-fat meal on pulmonary function in healthy subjects] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20165863)
* [High fat intake leads to acute postprandial exposure to circulating endotoxin in type 2 diabetic subjects] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22210577)
* [A saturated fatty acid-rich diet induces an obesity-linked proinflammatory gene expression profile in adipose tissue of subjects at risk of metabolic syndrome] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19828712)
* [Development of Symptomatic Cardiovascular Disease after Self-Reported Adherence to the Atkins Diet] (http://www.andjrnl.org/article/S0002-8223(09)00452-0/abstract)
* [The capacity of foodstuffs to induce innate immune activation of human monocytes in vitro is dependent on food content of stimulants of Toll-like receptors 2 and 4] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20849668) - The ingestion of fatty meals is associated with a transient, low-grade systemic inflammatory response in human subjects, involving the activation of circulating monocytes and the secretion of pro-inflammatory cytokines.
* [High cholesterol intake modifies chylomicron metabolism in normolipidemic young men] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16549459)
* [Effect of short-term starvation versus high-fat diet on intramyocellular triglyceride accumulation and insulin resistance in physically fit men] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/16627573)

##Erectile Dysfunction & Fertility
* [How to save a life during a clinic visit for erectile dysfunction by modifying cardiovascular risk factors] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19693019)
* [Subclinical endothelial dysfunction and low-grade inflammation play roles in the development of erectile dysfunction in young men with low risk of coronary heart disease] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22519624)
* [A population-based, longitudinal study of erectile dysfunction and future coronary artery disease] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19181643) 
* [Urinary metabolites of di(2-ethylhexyl) phthalate are associated with decreased steroid hormone levels in adult men] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=Urinary+metabolites+of+di(2-ethylhexyl)+phthalate+are+associated+with+decreased+steroid+hormone+levels+in+adult+men.+J+Androl.+2009+May-Jun%3B30(3)%3A287-97)

##B12
* [Dried green and purple lavers (Nori) contain substantial amounts of biologically active vitamin B(12) but less of dietary iodine relative to other edible seaweeds] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/10794633)

##Pregnancy
* [Decrease in Anogenital Distance among Male Infants with Prenatal Phthalate Exposure] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1280349/) - Less AGD in babies, less fertility as they grow up.
* [Prenatal phthalate exposure and reduced masculine play in boys] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2874619/pdf/nihms-158991.pdf)

##Pediatric
* [The pediatric aspects of atherosclerosis] (http://www.atherosclerosis-journal.com/article/S0368-1319(69)80020-7/abstract)
* [Atherosclerosis in youth] (http://europepmc.org/abstract/MED/12244281/reload=0;jsessionid=LgelpF26ZVp4Wk7W2xyb.12)
* [Exposure to exogenous estrogen through intake of commercial milk produced from pregnant cows] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19496976) 
* [Plasma Phthalate Levels in Pubertal Gynecomastia] (http://pediatrics.aappublications.org/content/125/1/e122.full)
* [Attained height of lacto-ovo vegetarian children and adolescents] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/1855500)

##Fruit
* [The effect of two energy-restricted diets, a low-fructose diet versus a moderate natural fructose diet, on weight loss and metabolic syndrome parameters: a randomized controlled trial] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/21621801)
* [Polyphenols and phenolic acids from strawberry and apple decrease glucose uptake and transport by human intestinal Caco-2 cells] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20564476)
* [Dietary polyphenols decrease glucose uptake by human intestinal Caco-2 cells] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15757656)
* [Industrial, not fruit fructose intake is associated with the severity of liver fibrosis in genotype 1 chronic hepatitis C patients] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23933265)
* [Postprandial glucose, insulin, and free fatty acid responses to sucrose consumed with blackcurrants and lingonberries in healthy women] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22854401)
* [Anti-hyperglycemic and anti-hyperlipidemic effects of Vaccinium myrtillus fruit in experimentally induced diabetes (antidiabetic effect of Vaccinium myrtillus fruit)] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25704796)

##Fish
* [Alkylphenols and alkylphenol ethoxylates contamination of crustaceans and fishes from the Adriatic Sea (Italy)] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/15833488)
* [Seafood Allergy, Toxicity, and Intolerance: A Review] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26252073)
* [Microbiological assessment along the fish production chain of the Norwegian pelagic fisheries sector - Results from a spot sampling programme] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26187839)

##Eggs
* [Egg yolk consumption and carotid plaque] (http://www.atherosclerosis-journal.com/article/S0021-9150%2812%2900504-7/abstract)
* [Egg consumption and the risk of type 2 diabetes mellitus: a case-control study] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22390963)
* [Detection of increased choline compounds with proton nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy subsequent to malignant transformation of human prostatic epithelial cells] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/11325827)
* [Choline intake and risk of lethal prostate cancer: incidence and survival] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/22952174)
* [Intestinal Microbial Metabolism of Phosphatidylcholine and Cardiovascular Risk] (http://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMoa1109400?query=featured_home)
* [1C-choline vs. 18F-FDG PET/CT in assessing bone involvement in patients with multiple myeloma] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17584499)
* [Intakes of meat, fish, poultry, and eggs and risk of prostate cancer progression] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20042525)
* [Plasma choline metabolites and colorectal cancer risk in the Women's Health Initiative Observational Study] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/25336191) 

##Additional Information
* [Nutritional Update for Physicians: Plant-Based Diets] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3662288/)
* [Eat Vegan on $4.00 a Day] (http://www.amazon.co.uk/Eat-Vegan-4-00-Day-Conscious/dp/1570672571)
* [Position of the American Dietetic Association: vegetarian diets] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19562864)
* [Humans evolved large brains because our ancestors ate starchy carbohydrates] (http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-3189454/The-secret-man-s-intelligence-POTATOES-Humans-evolved-large-brains-ancestors-ate-starchy-carbohydrates.html)
* [Oldest Human Tumor Found in Neanderthal Bone] (http://www.livescience.com/37194-neanderthal-oldest-tumor.html)
* [Masai and Inuit High-Protein Diets: A Closer Look] (http://nutritionstudies.org/masai-and-inuit-high-protein-diets-a-closer-look/)
* [UN urges global move to meat and dairy-free diet] (http://www.theguardian.com/environment/2010/jun/02/un-report-meat-free-diet)i
* [T.Colin Campbell Vs Weston Price Foundation advocates] (http://www.vegsource.com/articles2/campbell_china_response.htm#storyContinued)
* [The Paleo Diet Is Uncivilized (And Unhealthy and Untrue)] (https://www.drmcdougall.com/misc/2012nl/jun/paleo2.htm)
* [Twenty questions on atherosclerosis] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1312295/)
* [Dr T Colin Campbell Responds to Criticism of Whole Food, Vegan Diets] (https://youtu.be/a4oVFJS1tt4?t=48m2s)

##Ketogenic Diets and Neurologic Illnesses
* [he ketogenic diet: uses in epilepsy and other neurologic illnesses] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/18990309/)
* [Potential Therapeutic Use of the Ketogenic Diet in Autism Spectrum Disorders] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4074854/)
* [The neuropharmacology of the ketogenic diet] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17509459/)
* [The calorically restricted ketogenic diet, an effective alternative therapy for malignant brain cancer] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/17313687)
* [Targeting energy metabolism in brain cancer through calorie restriction and the ketogenic diet] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20009300)

##Weight Regain after Weight Loss
* [The defence of body weight: a physiological basis for weight regain after weight loss] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23126426) 
* [Biology's response to dieting: the impetus for weight regain] (http://ajpregu.physiology.org/content/301/3/R581)
* [Peripheral metabolic responses to prolonged weight reduction that promote rapid, efficient regain in obesity-prone rats] (http://ajpregu.physiology.org/content/290/6/R1577)
* [Calorie restriction induces mitochondrial biogenesis and bioenergetic efficiency] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1413655/pdf/pnas-0510452103.pdf)
* [A distinct adipose tissue gene expression response to caloric restriction predicts 6-mo weight maintenance in obese subjects] (http://ajcn.nutrition.org/content/94/6/1399.full.pdf+html)

##Junk Science
* [Diets with high-fat cheese, high-fat meat, or carbohydrate on cardiovascular risk markers in overweight postmenopausal women: a randomized crossover trial] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/26178720) - 2 week trial, 14 women = not nearly enough to establish cause
* [Meta-analysis of prospective cohort studies evaluating the association of saturated fat with cardiovascular disease] (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20071648) - [Badly done] (http://news.sciencemag.org/health/2014/03/scientists-fix-errors-controversial-paper-about-saturated-fats) and [misleading] (http://www.hsph.harvard.edu/nutritionsource/2014/03/19/dietary-fat-and-heart-disease-study-is-seriously-misleading/). If you group people up in an observational study, some people will have different starting points for their cholesterol because of their genes. If you do an interventional study, you will be able to affect people's cholesterol levels.
